705765f-a.text:
Montague Street, south side, west from Fulton StreetC At the extreme left, is the Continental Insurance Building, next to it the Old Academy of Music, next to it the Academy of Design. The trolley tracks are no longer on Montague Street. The clock on the right, was still keeping
time in (1936). This whole block has been renovated.
About 1890.

Eugene L. Armbruster Colleotion.

703832f-a.text:
Court Street, west side, from Montague (right) to Remsen Streets. On the extreme right is the Mechanics Bank Building at the northwest corner of Court and Montague Streets. To the left of it, at the S.W. corner of the two streets, is the Continental Insurance Building (narrow buildfng) and the Phoenix Tnsurance Building. These two were torn down in 1926 and the 35-story Montague-Court Building erected on the site. The clearance to the left of the Phoenix Building, which is the northwest corner of Court and Remsen Streets, is the former site of the Garfield Building, where the 29-story Court-Remsen Building was later put up. The view is across Borough Hall Park from Fulton Street. The statue (center left) is that of Henry Ward Beecher, d'stinguished preacher of the Plymouth Church and
abolitionist.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  1925

703834f-a.text:
Court Street, south from and inclading Msntague Street.  In the foreground is the Court Street Station of the Fulton Street B.M.T. Elevated line. In the backgroand is seen the Sorough Hall Building, with ite tower and clock; in back thereof is shown the new Municipal Building.
1928.

705764f-a.text:
Montague Street, north side, west from Court Street. At 197 is seen The Montague Street branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. The building
was erected in 1867.
December 1925.
Brown Brothers.

705766f-a.text:
Montagde Street, south side, west from Court Street, showing a rear view of the Academy of Musio, opened in 1861 at a cost of over 1200,000. It was destroyed by fire in 1903. At the right, is the steeple of the Church of the Holy Trinity. In the background is the Pierrepont Hotel.
1902.
Eugene L. Armbruater Collection.
